title: Space travel
description:
To learn new things in the JavaScript ecosystem, I picked a mobile app design on Dribbble, extended it to a responsive web application in Figma and then created it with React, GraphQL (using Apollo) and styled-components on the frontend. On the backend, I used the GraphQL ORM-like layer Prisma on top of a MySQL database.

The app allows users to buy a one-way ticket to a Planet in the Solar System in a situation when the environment on Earth is not livable anymore (the tickets canâ€™t be used, yet). Customers can check the air quality in their location to help them to make an informed decision.

I wanted to try out some real-time UI updates so in the ordering process when selecting a seat you can see when another user has selected a seat in the same spaceship as you.

title: Image gallery
description: A school project made using PHP and MySQL database allowing users to upload and like images. There is implemented infinite scrolling and the app works even with disabled JavaScript.

title: Movies mobile app
description:
Built with React Native and Firebase for authentication.

This application was my venture to deepen my experience in the React ecosystem by trying out React Native. I implemented component with a map, made an interactive SVG animation responding to user gestures and checked whether it was possible to create D3.js visualizations using a native SVG library.
